title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Friday, 3 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: a hertfordshire man has been sentenced to life in prison for the murder of a woman he met through a dating website .
woburn sands long jumper greg rutherford wins the diamond league event in rome .
police say they still have n't been able to identify a severed head believed to have come from sharnbrook .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the local live team today .
friday 's headlines have included :
we 'll be back with you on monday from 08:00
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: bletchley park : how hitler 's lorenz cipher was broken
text: equipment used to break the german lorenz cipher was demonstrated at the bletchley park based national museum of computing today .
this is how it all worked

documents.title: weather : mist could bring drizzle later
text: there is a chance of patchy drizzle this evening as the temperature dips to 10c ( 50f ) .
overnight mist will clear as we work through saturday morning to leave sunshine , but a risk of heavy showers as it peaks at 22c ( 72f ) .
for more detail , visit bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: carl langdell sentencing : mental health trust alerted police about killer
text: the mental health trust which dealt with killer carl langdell says it reported his earlier threats to police .
langdell has been jailed for a minimum of 26 years for killing katie locke , 23 , in hertfordshire on christmas eve .

a spokesman for avon & wiltshire mental health partnership nhs trust , said : `` at the point [ early 2015 ] he made a specific threat against a named individual , our staff took immediate and appropriate action to inform the police .
`` criminal justice procedures were subsequently instigated and he was formally discharged from our services . ''
langdell , 26 , from cheshunt , hertfordshire was sentenced at st albans crown court this morning .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: england women prepare to come to wycombe
text: the england 's men 's team have played their final warm up match for the euro 2016 but tomorrow all eyes will be on the lionesses .
the uefa women 's 2017 european championship qualifier will be held at adams park in high wycombe .
the game , against serbia , kicks off at 17:30 .
all the information on how to get there and to watch the game is on the wycombe wanderes website , but if you ca n't get there you can watch it on bbc two from 17:00 .
author: Luke Ashmead
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: watford release defender ekstrand
text: watford release defender ekstrand

documents.title: poulter injury means he 's unlikely to feature in ryder cup
text: woburn 's ian poulter will miss the next four months of the season with a foot injury .
the ryder cup is at the end of september and start of october , so he 's almost certain to miss out .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: 'depraved ' first date killer jailed
text: 'depraved ' first date killer jailed

documents.title: cc smugglers set to 'take it to the bridge ' for bbc music day
text: anyone who can make it to bedford tonight is being asked to `` take it to the bridge '' .
a special performance by cc smugglers will take place at the town 's suspension bridge on the embankment from 18:30 .
it 's your chance to see a bbc introducing band who will be supporting the boss , bruce springsteen on his upcoming tour .
the whole event is all part of the second annual bbc music day .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police constable dismissed after misconduct hearing into paralysed moped rider
text: one officer has lost his job , while another has been issued with a warning at the end of a police misconduct hearing .

the hearing was told the officers seemed more interested in making an arrest than helping a boy who had come off his moped following an incident where he was riding it on a footpath in hemel hempstead .
pc stuart francis has been instantly dismissed after being found guilty of gross misconduct .
pc rishi patel was found guilty of misconduct and received a written warning from hertfordshire police .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: war time computer re-enactments take place at bletchley park
text: how do you crack hitler 's most secret cipher ?
for the first time ever , all the equipment used in making and breaking the german lorenz cipher has been demonstrated and re-enacted at the national museum of computing at bletchley park .
the demos included encrypting and decrypting messages using original and reconstructed equipment in the presence of re-enactment wrens and cryptanalysts .
among them was irene dixon ( below ) , one of the very first colossus wren operators .
i had the great pleasure of interviewing her and she told me they realised they were working in codes , but did n't know they were working on `` hitler codes '' .
author: Nick Higham
BBC Correspondent

documents.title: more from the police misconduct hearing
text: pcs francis and patel denied using excessive force on the injured boy and of providing dishonest or misleading accounts of what happened .
one witness , lisa sandridge , told the hearing : `` his [ pc francis 's ] behaviour was terrible .
he did n't show any concern .
he gave him no first aid .
`` pc rishi patel was kneeling on christian-lee 's legs as he was worried he was going to be kicked in the face .
`` christian-lee was in no state to be kicking anyone in the face . ''
the hearing in hatfield is yet to decide what action will be taken against the two officers .

documents.title: misconduct hearing finds police officers guilty
text: christian-lee thompson , now aged 16 , was left paralysed and with brain damage after the incident on a disused railway line in hemel hempstead in july of last year .
he did n't have a helmet on at the time and was riding in an area only meant for walkers and cyclists .
the officer denied trying to arrest him using unnecessary force and providing misleading accounts of what happened .
pc stuart francis was found guilty of gross misconduct and pc rishi patel of misconduct .
author: Nicola Haseler
BBC Three Counties

documents.title: police officers guilty of misconduct for using force on injured teenager
text: a hertfordshire police officer has been found guilty of misconduct over their use of force when a teenager was injured while coming off a moped .
pc stuart francis was found guilty of gross misconduct at a police disciplinary hearing over the way he dealt with 15-year-old christian-lee thompson .
pc rishi patel was found guilty of misconduct .
author: Nicola Haseler
BBC Three Counties

documents.title: breakinghertfordshire police officers found guilty at misconduct hearing
text: two hertfordshire police officers have been found guilty at a misconduct hearing today .
it comes after a boy left paralysed after being knocked off his moped was held to the ground by police .
more to follow .

documents.title: residents 'furious ' after human waste left behind after travellers leave
text: i 've been talking to a very angry richard roberts , who lives in dunstable close to where a group of travellers have left tonnes of rubbish behind after leaving a site in the town .
he says there 's human excrement on the nearby cycleway , adding if he did a quarter of the damage left he 'd be `` arrested '' .
he told me the matter has been going on for months and the council needs to `` find them a plot of land '' and `` sort it out . ''
author: Matt Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: clean up operations at dunstable travellers ' site expected to take several hours
text: council workers are currently cleaning up a high amount of rubbish left behind by travellers in dunstable .
the team from biffa waste management are expected to be finished this afternoon .
the mess was left after a number of caravans left the site last night .
author: Matt Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travellers leave tonnes of rubbish behind in dunstable
text: more than 1.5 tonnes ( 1500kg ) of rubbish have been left behind by a group of travellers in dunstable .
i 've seen the waste , which includes human excrement , and was left at a skatepark behind the grove theatre in the town .
there 's also tyre damage on surrounding fields .
author: Matt Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: fire in disused building at bletchley park
text: there 's been a fire in an unoccupied building at bletchley park .
it 's been confirmed to us that it was n't one of the buildings on the heritage site , but was a derelict building dating from 1943 .
it was an extension of block d .
crews from bletchley , great holm , newport pagnell and winslow attended .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: when the england team came to aylesbury
text: twenty-eight years ago a bit of history was made in aylesbury
the england team came to buckingham road to complete their preparations for euro '88 .
you might even spot a rather younger gary lineker in his pants a sight we may or may not see again soon on match of the day .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mk dons to sign millwall 's upson
text: mk dons to sign millwall 's upson

documents.title: bhs : collapse 'fuels public distrust of business '
text: hundreds of staff at nine bhs stores across beds , bucks and herts are set to lose their jobs .
in all , 11,000 jobs will go across the country after the company went into liquidation .
all 163 stores will hold closing down sales over the next few weeks .
the director general of the institute of directors , simon walker , has accused the former owners of bhs of `` lamentable failures '' , saying its collapse has fuelled public distrust in uk plc .

documents.title: that 's all from the langdell sentencing
text: that 's all from our live coverage of the sentencing of carl langdell .
to recap , he has been jailed for a minimum of 26 years for the murder of teacher katie locke on christmas eve .
you can read the full story here .
we 'll now take a look at other stories happening where you live .

documents.title: langdell sentencing : killer 's controlling behaviour highlighted in court
text: the main thing to come out of court today is just how controlling 26-year-old carl langdell is .
i heard only this week that he sacked his own defence team , so for the past few days he 's represented himself .
after the sentencing langdell , from roundmoore drive in cheshunt , asked the judge if he could correct him on one thing .
judge andrew bright responded by saying `` you will have to go through your legal team . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : family tried to find katie after she did n't return home on christmas eve
text: we 've just heard from the crown prosecution service ( cps ) how the family of essex teacher , katie locke , made a `` concerted effort to identify langdell '' after she did n't return home on christmas eve .
adrian foster , from the cps , said friends and family searched the internet and contacted 26-year-old langdell , from roundmoore drive , cheshunt via facebook .
he told them miss locke had left in a taxi and he did n't know where she was .
her father , bill , worked out where langdell lived and drove there .
they found out langdell had admitted the murder to his mother .
police were called , and he was found and arrested .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : suspended sentence for previous offence defended by police
text: the detective at the heart of the carl langdell murder case said a previous conviction for threats to kill a nurse had been `` taken seriously '' .

langdell , 26 , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt , today sentenced to 16 years for killing essex teacher katie locke , had been given a suspended sentence for the threats to kill offence - just 22 days before he murdered miss locke .
det insp fraser wylie said while langdell had a `` behavioural disorder , '' there had been no need to have him locked up as many people who have issues like that `` do not go on to kill '' .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : first date murderer a 'vile and evil ' man
text: a `` vile , evil , controlling fantasist '' .
that is how police have described carl langdell , who sexually assaulted and murdered essex teacher katie locke .
langdell , 26 , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt in hertfordshire , was today sentenced to 26 years in jail .
det insp fraser wylie said langdell used dating websites to `` target young women '' .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : parents of murdered teacher say killer will 'forever be a danger '
text: the parents of essex teacher , katie locke , have paid tribute to a precious , beautiful , bright , funny , and caring young woman .
they say they 've been `` robbed of a precious daughter , '' whose trusting nature was her `` downfall '' .
carl langdell , 26 , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt in hertfordshire , was today sentenced to life for murdering miss locke .
her parents said he will `` forever be a danger to the public . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : judge 'doubts murderer will ever be released ' from prison
text: the judge at the sentencing hearing of first date murderer carl langdell said he doubts the killer will ever be released from prison .
judge andrew bright told st albans crown court he was pessimistic psychiatric treatment would bring about any long term change in the 26-year-old from cheshunt , hertfordshire .

he said dr philip joseph - `` arguably the country 's most experienced consultant forensic psychiatrist '' - had said langdell suffers `` from an emotionally unstable and dissociate psychopathic personality disorder '' meaning he poses a risk to women that .
`` is likely to remain significant for the foreseeable future '' .
langdell murdered essex teacher katie locke at a five star hotel on christmas eve .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : killer had already been convicted for threats to kill before teacher murder
text: a man who murdered a young teacher on their first date was serving a suspended sentence for threats to kill .
carl langdell , 26 , sexual assaulted essex teacher katie locke before taking of her corpse .
langdell , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt , who appeared at st albans crown court via a video link from bedford prison , was jailed for life today .
in march last year , he was sentenced to nine months in jail , suspended for 24 months , for threats to kill - just 22 days before he murdered miss locke .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : judge describes killer as 'depraved '
text: the serious sexual nature of the murder of teacher katie locke `` increased the depravity '' of the offence , according to the judge sentencing hertfordshire man , carl langdell .
speaking at st albans crown court , judge andrew bright told langdell , 26 , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt , that he poses `` a very great danger to women and young girls '' .
he added : `` i note that you have described yourself to others as a monster and a psychopath . ''

langdell pleaded guilty at an earlier hearing to murdering miss locke , from buckhurst hill , essex in the four star theobolds park hotel in hertfordshire and dumping her body under a bush in a ditch near a skip .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: langdell sentencing : first date murderer must serve minimum of 26 years
text: a man who murdered a teacher on their first date has been handed a life sentence with a minimum term of 26 years .
carl langdell , 26 , from roundmoor drive , cheshunt , pleaded guilty to killing 23-year-old teacher katie locke , from buckhurst hill in essex , at a hotel in waltham cross on christmas eve .
the sentence was made at st albans crown court just a few moments ago .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: breakingcarl langdell sentenced to life in prison
text: carl langdell , from hertfordshire , has been sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 26 years for the murder of katie locke from essex .
more to come .

documents.title: katie locke murder sentencing due later
text: the sentencing of a hertfordshire man for the sexually motivated murder of a woman he 'd met through a dating site is expected at st albans crown court later .
carl langdell admitted killing 23-year-old teacher , katie locke , on christmas eve at thebalds park hotel in waltham cross .
he pleaded guilty at a hearing in march .
as soon as we have the result i 'll bring it to you .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: still no identification in 'severed head ' case
text: there 's still no word on the identity of a severed human head believed to have come from a construction site in sharnbrook , bedfordshire .
the head was discovered in a quarry in mepal , cambridgeshire , over a fortnight ago .
it had been taken there from sharnbrook , but police do n't know how it came to be on the construction site .
police are still unable to confirm the gender of the victim and say further dna checks are taking place .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : rather cloudy and dull day
text: it 's a largely dull and cool start to the day , with some spots of rain .
through this afternoon , it will remain cloudy .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : hurst grove in bedford closed
text: hurst grove in bedford will be closed today from 09:00 and 15:30 so repair works can be carried out .
hurst grove , bedford will be closed tomorrow between winifred road and bromham road 9.00am - 3.30pm for repairs .

documents.title: outcome of herts police misconduct hearing expected
text: two hertfordshire police officers will find out later the outcome of their misconduct hearings .
pcs stuart francis and rishi patel both deny using excessive force when dealing with injured 15-year-old christian-lee thomspson , who came off his moped in hemel hempstead .
the officers deny trying to arrest him using unnecessary force and providing misleading accounts .
the hearing in hatfield is due to finish today and i 'll be there bringing you the latest news .
author: Nicola Haseler
BBC Three Counties

documents.title: rutherford to decide tomorrow if he 'll jump on sunday
text: greg rutherford has just tweeted that he 'll make a decision tomorrow as to whether he 'll jump in birmingham on sunday .
he does n't sound happy about the new field event rules either .
for people hoping to watch me jump in birmingham i 'll make a final decision tomorrow .
a bit sore today but hoping to be on point by sunday
fingers crossed
hoping the robin jinx is n't striking again , come down anyway and do a lap of honour ; )
did think two diamond leagues in 4 days was tough .
if 4 athlete rule is an issue , do 3 rounds and withdraw - protest
do what you need to .
everyone knows you always perform for a british crowd if you can so no one will gripe if you miss it
well done and good luck for sunday would love to watch you fingers crossed .
haha
go on greg !
you can do it for us !
there is a major issue with the new field event rule .
it 's dangerous to athletes , so that also has to be considered .
fingers crossed though
all jumpers/throwers should sit in the sandpit/throwing circle/field after the third round and refuse to move .
hate the rule but please dont blame officials we hate the rule too : (
what is the new rule ?
do you blame your soreness on the new rule greg ?
personally , the sooner they scrap it , the better !
it 's demeaning and belittling , but i would be interested to know the health and safety element involved .
dangerous as in : not enough rest between jumps ?
it is a stupid rule , unfair to those who do n't get the maximum jumps .
ps .
congrats on your victory .
the dl three jump/throw elimination ?
had n't thought of a danger element - what might that be ?
what is this new rule greg ?

documents.title: greg rutherford thanks fans for 'support '
text: woburn sands long jumper greg rutherford has thanked his fans for all their support after winning in rome last night
thanks for all the support yesterday .
8.31 is n't a bad result but i always want more .
great to get another win with such a good field
keep the season bests coming .
# peaking just in time for # rio # olym @ twitterid
you can always do better in birmingham with british supporters xxx
awesome job mate
well done !
saw your result on cbbc newsround but not on @ twitterid news , oddly enough .
great jump !
how quick do you do 100m cos your run up is unbelievably quick !
how 's the `` every jump over 8.1m '' going mr r ?
do you think that going into the olym as defending champion you will feel greater pressure to perform ?
# questiontime
8.31m rings a bell maybe it 's a sign on the road to rio .
well done greg

documents.title: mk 's greg rutherford may drop out of sunday 's jump to 'rest his body '
text: after his win the milton keynes jumper greg rutherford , who remains unbeaten in 2016 , hinted he may pull out of sunday 's birmingham diamond league to rest his body .
he is unhappy with changes to the diamond league competition that mean four athletes contest the closing stages , rather than eight .
with less recovery time between jumps , rutherford said athletes were `` incredibly frustrated '' , adding : `` you ca n't perform . ''
he also hinted he may pull out birmingham to `` preserve the body '' .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: jumping for joy : mk 's greg rutherford wins in rome
text: milton keynes ' olympic long jump champion greg rutherford produced a season 's best to win the diamond league meeting in rome .
the briton jumped 8.31 metres in round two of the event , the same mark he achieved to claim gold at london 2012 .
american marquise goodwin was second with 8.19m , just ahead of france 's fabrice lapierre , who jumped 8.18m .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: good morning and welcome to beds , herts and bucks live
text: the nearest any of us will have got to a sun kissed beach so far this june , will have been watching greg rutherford hit the sand in rome .
but the champion long jumper , from woburn sands , helped ease the chill of so-called summer - for a while a least - by winning the diamond league event .
we 'll be bringing you more on that , and the latest weather , along with all the news , sport and travel from now until 18:00 .
you can , of course , get in touch at any time via , twitter or email .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live
